commit_message:
V2 Pause: treat case when driver does not implement the operation

Some virt drivers may not support this operation.

Same change will be added to V3 when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58432
is merged.

Change-Id: I7763f462dd8f61c29c79038d881dc015482a9b5c

Update HP 3PAR QoS settings

Also list the new personas.

commit_message:
Removes the dependence with aptitude

Removes the dependence with aptitude by replacing
the call of:
  aptitude purge -y ~npackage by apt_get purge -y package*

Change-Id: I08875ffad9dc6293047827666f02453a355b16ea
Closes-Bug: 1281410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/11/75711/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apt_get purge -y erlang*

commit_message:
Replace 'tenant' in config options with 'project'

configuration options with 'tenant' in the name should be deprecated in
favor of configuration options with 'project' in the name.

Change-Id: Icdb099984687488eac1f4cd77be75ef829b773de
Closes-bug: #1283841

commit_message:
Migrate log_{file,dir} params to neutron class

The log_{dir,file} params was configured in the neutron class::server,
these parameters was not available classes neutron::agent::*
This patch fixes this.

(cherry picked from commit c751443f4fef5e71c0246b5410a2b712aeb656d4)
Closes-bug: #1282296
Change-Id: I205b0ed5db08199000ec11b2212afedf67bf2ed7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/85/76485/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # REMOVED: Use log_file of neutron class instead.# REMOVED: Use log_dir of neutron class instead. $log_dir = undef, $log_file = undef, if $log_dir { fail('The log_dir parameter is removed, use log_dir of neutron class instead.') } if $log_file { fail('The log_file parameter is removed, use log_file of neutron class instead.') }
deleted_lines: # (optional) Where to log # Defaults to false# (optional) Directory where logs should be stored # If set to boolean false, it will not log to any directory # Defaults to /var/log/neutron $log_file = false, $log_dir = '/var/log/neutron', if $log_file { neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/log_file': value => $log_file; 'DEFAULT/log_dir': ensure => absent; } } else { if $log_dir { neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/log_dir': value => $log_dir; 'DEFAULT/log_file': ensure => absent; } } else { neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/log_dir': ensure => absent; 'DEFAULT/log_file': ensure => absent; } } }

commit_message:
Display more specific error on image creation

When the creation of an image, whose size exceeds the limit set in quota,
is attempted, the error message displayed to the user is just a generic one.
Display a more detailed error message in this case.

Change-Id: I9582be72670a9243fb48c6a92a0ad2b91c2a52f5
Closes-Bug: #1270817

commit_message:
only add service_plugins option if there are some plugins defined

Fixes: bug 1284829

Only add a service_plugins option to the neutron.conf file if you have
defined at least one plugin in the attribute
['openstack']['network']['service_plugins']

Change-Id: Ia13593ad2bfe6ad7904650e3835b074c4281f8be

commit_message:
Migrate log_{file,dir} params to neutron class

The log_{dir,file} params was configured in the neutron class::server,
these parameters was not available classes neutron::agent::*
This patch fixes this.

(This patch must be backported to havana (for #1282296))

Closes-bug: #1282296
Change-Id: I205b0ed5db08199000ec11b2212afedf67bf2ed7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/90/76290/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # DEPRECATED: Use log_file of neutron class instead.# DEPRECATED: Use log_dir of neutron class instead. $log_dir = undef, $log_file = undef, if $log_dir { warning('The log_dir parameter is deprecated, use log_dir of neutron class instead.') } if $log_file { warning('The log_file parameter is deprecated, use log_file of neutron class instead.') }
deleted_lines: # (optional) Where to log # Defaults to false# (optional) Directory where logs should be stored # If set to boolean false, it will not log to any directory # Defaults to /var/log/neutron $log_file = false, $log_dir = '/var/log/neutron', if $log_file { neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/log_file': value => $log_file; 'DEFAULT/log_dir': ensure => absent; } } else { if $log_dir { neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/log_dir': value => $log_dir; 'DEFAULT/log_file': ensure => absent; } } else { neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/log_dir': ensure => absent; 'DEFAULT/log_file': ensure => absent; } } }

commit_message:
VMware: remove unused parameter from _wait_for_task

The patch set removes the instance_uuid parameter from the
_wait_for_task method. This parameter was not used. In certain cases
an arbitrary data structure was passed to the method.

Change-Id: Idc578d6e962a63ff6c3c39f42bb0d888c6d1c7fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/73965/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def fake_poll_task(task_ref, done): self.conn._wait_for_task, 'fake-ref') def fake_wait_for_task(task_ref): return self.wait_task(task_ref)
deleted_lines: def fake_poll_task(instance_uuid, task_ref, done): self.conn._wait_for_task, 'fake-id', 'fake-ref') def fake_wait_for_task(instance_uuid, task_ref): return self.wait_task(instance_uuid, task_ref)

commit_message:
Quantum API _get_floating_ip_by_address mismatch with Nova-Net

_get_floating_ip_by_address() has a unspecified behavior when
IP address is empty and only one floating IP is allocated in
the pool. It should return a 404 Not found like Nova-Net does
but instead returns the only IP in the pool.

Closes-Bug: 1190242

(cherry picked from commit 40126fdb920710e2ffbc481bbe9ddf6d0e047af3)
Change-Id: Id4843edda8e66ccabab5e9d053c595a1cd247770
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/46033/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Enable custom video RAM setting

hw_video_ram can be provided via the image properties in Glance.
The value should be provided in MB.
hw_video_ram will be honoured, during an instance creation,
only if a coresponding hw_video:ram_max_mb value has been set in the flavor's
extra_specs and it's higher than the requested amount in hw_video_ram.

    glance image-update \
       --property hw_video_model=qxl \
       --property hw_video_ram=64 \
       [image]

DocImpact
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-video-driver-selection

Change-Id: I125cdc2afa27986ead9a81d925125a6a3ecce145

commit_message:
changes to lab001-control-node

a ssh to an ssh
changed control to controller node
Added the before OpenStack
vSwitch spelling corrected
changed plural on add
added space in volumegroup
don't needs apostrophe
changed like this to following steps
added :
added space after .
changed to do not and added perform

Change-Id: I4c830b03a7d955a9f1948876cc31cac64c7dcf4d

commit_message:
Add link to dev docs for TaskFlow

Since taskflow is now part of oslo, we need a link to its developer
documentation from projects page.

Closes-bug: #1279951
Change-Id: Ie0facd50e4f5fe178ece850bd05557c3eaf63988
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/23/76123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

TaskFlow

A Python library that helps make task execution easy, consistent, and reliable.

commit_message:
NSX: Fix newly created port's status should be DOWN

Previously when creating a port in neutron using the nsx plugin
the port status returned would be ACTIVE even if this was not the
case. Now, DOWN is returned which will be updated by the backend
when the port goes ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I600fb1292ae79146cb14c7e23170262973878de0
Closes-bug: #1279551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/86/73086/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set port status as 'DOWN'. This will be updated by backend sync. port_data['status'] = constants.PORT_STATUS_DOWN print neutron_db

commit_message:
Configuration options for the HP MSA array

Describe how cinder must be configured to use the new HP MSA Fiber Channel
driver.

Change-Id: I8e7a4fea5ee81b593f06038fd134f8d5db5ba704
Closes-Bug: #1283349
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/95/75695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="hp-msa-driver" xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0"> <title>HP MSA Fibre Channel driver</title> <para>The HP MSA fiber channel driver runs volume operations on the storage array over HTTP.</para> <para>A VDisk must be created on the HP MSA array first. This can be done using the web interface or the command line (SSH) of the MSA array.</para> <para>The following options must be defined in the <systemitem>cinder-volume</systemitem> configuration file (<filename>/etc/cinder/cinder.conf</filename>):</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Set the <option>volume_driver</option> option to <literal>cinder.volumes.drivers.san.hp.hp_msa_fc.HPMSAFCDriver</literal> </para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Set the <option>san_ip</option> option to the hostname or IP address of your HP MSA array.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Set the <option>san_login</option> option to the login of an existing user of the HP MSA array. </para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Set the <option>san_password</option> option to the password for this user.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section>

subject: Set default log level of iso8601 to WARN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-25 02:53:58.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/b3b14a8605068602e8749a48c25c02aeb252e0be', 'message': "Set default log level of iso8601 to WARN

In openstack.common.log, the iso8601's default log level is WARN.
But ceilometer doesn't set WARN as default log level of iso8601.
This may cause a lot of DEBUG level message recorded in log files if we
haven't configured the default log level in ceilometer.conf.

Change-Id: I8edbcd5f0885b424c70483180b479588bca254a2
Closes-Bug: #1284412
"}]
commit_message:
Set default log level of iso8601 to WARN

In openstack.common.log, the iso8601's default log level is WARN.
But ceilometer doesn't set WARN as default log level of iso8601.
This may cause a lot of DEBUG level message recorded in log files if we
haven't configured the default log level in ceilometer.conf.

Change-Id: I8edbcd5f0885b424c70483180b479588bca254a2
Closes-Bug: #1284412
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/75/76075/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'eventlet.wsgi.server=WARN', 'iso8601=WARN'

Separate negative tests for test_projects

Move negative tests from test_projects.py to test_projects_negative.py

Partially implements blueprint negative-test-files

commit_message:
py3kcompat: remove in python-ceilometerclient

Everything is already in six>=1.4.0 and we already depend on such a
version. There's no reason to keep this file. So remove py3kcompat
from python-ceilometerclient.

Change-Id: Ide6876e7a60377cb3843816d1d9ab2c589bc8f1b
Closes-Bug: #1280033

commit_message:
Enable openvswitch

On Red Hat distros enable openvswitch after it is started.
So comes up on reboot.

Change-Id: Ic0de1c5d541d91b771ed4a883f58f17d97d14d0e

commit_message:
Removal of methods from json/xml network_client files

Remove create_security_group, create_security_group_rule
from "json/network_client.py" and "xml/network_client.py"
and instead use "_creater"/"_updater" from "network_client_base.py"

Change-Id: I2f0b16ea832fe0704869a9d778a8d3ed518090cc

commit_message:
Add _retry_on_deadlock support for postgresql

The original "_retry_on_deadlock" function is only available for mysql.
We need to add support for postgresql.

The deadlock exception thrown from postgresql is TransactionRollbackError,
it's not the same with "OperationalError" thrown from mysql,
and isn't included in sqlalchemy. So, the base exception need to be catched.

Change-Id: I02d0bb946f009dbfaf066f23171cede6b21d35e2
Closes-Bug: #1270725
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/74743/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # postgresql: # (TransactionRollbackError) deadlock detected <deadlock_details> # _DEADLOCK_RE_DB = { "mysql": re.compile(r"^.*\(1213, 'Deadlock.*"), "postgresql" : re.compile(r"^.*deadlock detected.*") except sqla_exc.DBAPIError as e: # NOTE(wingwj): This branch is used to catch deadlock exception # under postgresql. The original exception thrown from postgresql # is TransactionRollbackError, it's not included in the sqlalchemy. # Moreover, DBAPIError is the base class of OperationalError # and IntegrityError, so we catch it on the end of the process. _raise_if_deadlock_error(e, get_engine().name) raise

commit_message:
remove audit logging on flush

in something as simple as the tempest gate, this creates 2.5 MB
of compressed logs. I do not believe there is any actual value
in logging the flush, especially as the failure to flush is
correctly logged.

Change-Id: I176bc13e5cacf892b07c4fed3871924500622d01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/29/76329/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use six.StringIO/BytesIO instead of StringIO.StringIO

to keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.StringIO/BytesIO to
replace StringIO.StringIO

StringIO works for unicode
BytesIO works for bytes

Change-Id: I1d4db56dd082916879b851f2d9ac71d17c0db94f
Closes-Bug: #1280100

commit_message:
Add IloDriver for HP Proliant Servers

Add new ironic driver for managing power and deploy
of HP Proliant Gen8 servers using iLO4.

Co-Authors: Anusha Ramineni <anusha.iiitm@gmail.com>
            Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia5d4a6ab926874f5d124064f37ed9504da080571
Implements: blueprint ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-driver
Implements: blueprint ironic-ilo-power-driver

@mock.patch('ironic.drivers.modules.ribcl_ilo.iLO') def test_validate(self, *args): ilomock = args[0] with task_manager.acquire(self.context, [self.node['uuid']], shared=True) as task: ilo_advanced_license = { 'LICENSE_TYPE': 'iLO 3 Advanced' } instance = ilomock.return_value instance.get_all_licenses.return_value = ilo_advanced_license ilodeploy = task.resources[0].driver.deploy ilodeploy.validate(self.node) @mock.patch('ironic.drivers.modules.ilo_deploy._set_one_time_boot') @mock.patch('ironic.drivers.modules.ilo_deploy._deploy_complete') test_deploy(self, *args): ilomock = args[0] with task_manager.acquire(self.context, [self.node['uuid']], shared=False) as task: instance = ilomock.return_value instance.get_host_power_status.side_effect = ['OFF', 'ON'] ilodeploy = task.resources[0].driver.deploy ilodeploy.deploy(task, self.node) self.assertEqual(args[1].call_count, 1) commit_message:
Add scaling size metadata to scaled mergable_types

By adding a scaling metadata property containing the size of the scaling
group we are able to make intelligent decisions in image elements about
the state of a cluster.

Change-Id: Ia530f39cbcee8051ed9f18b4a989678117bdd1c0

commit_message:
Update FibreChannel Zone Manager config

This patch changes the way the config options are
layed out in the cinder.conf to follow the
standards for grouping settings together.

Instead of using dynamic config names to group
settings together by fabric name, we look for
fabric groups based upon the fc_fabric_names.
We also create a new fc-zone-manager group
for all of the global fczm settings.

Change-Id: I91c8a05adec2fb12f664ca0df6007465c1a460e0
Closes-Bug: #1284338
DocImpact

commit_message:
Remove duplicated cms file

Co-Authored-By: David Stanek (dstanek@dstanek.com)

Until recently, the Unit tests for the Keystone client meant that
we could not use the most recent version of the client code inside
the server.  That lead to code duplication between client and server
for new features.  Now, we are only running unit tests against the
master branch of the client.  More and more common code can be moved
to the client without duplication.

cms was duplicated between the server and client.
Use the version from the client.

Tests for error handling problems in cms

commit_message:
Create stack_domain_admin user

Create an additional service user for Heat, which is a domain admin
for the stack_user_domain - this is necessary since the normal service
user cannot manage the projects/users in the stack_user_domain when
keystone is configured to use the v3cloudsample policy (such as in
gate integration tests).

Change-Id: If59c11a74145b9bd02f78a7e0882afe1b0a72e40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/36/76036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: U_ID=$(openstack --os-token $OS_TOKEN --os-url=$KS_ENDPOINT_V3 \ --os-identity-api-version=3 user create --password $SERVICE_PASSWORD \ --domain $D_ID heat_domain_admin \ --description "Manages users and projects created by heat" \ | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) openstack --os-token $OS_TOKEN --os-url=$KS_ENDPOINT_V3 \ --os-identity-api-version=3 role add \ --user ${U_ID} --domain ${D_ID} admin iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_domain_admin ${U_ID} iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_domain_admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD

commit_message:
Use six.StringIO/BytesIO instead of StringIO.StringIO

to keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.StringIO/BytesIO to
replace StringIO.StringIO

StringIO works for unicode
BytesIO works for bytes

Change-Id: I93e043c633e1de9e4dedcb0a313032403b6a70fb
Closes-Bug: #1280100

commit_message:
Implements resource type NetworkGateway

The NVP specific feature "Network Gateway" was added to Neutron in grizzly release.

  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/nvp-nwgw-api

This codes aims to add support OS::Neutron::NetworkGateway in heat.

Change-Id: I19aa51c40a216a31d4e5516c08e854a5d02c39a6
Implements: blueprint resource-type-nvp-network-gateway

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the 'License'); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an 'AS IS' BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from testtools import skipIf from heat.common import exception from heat.common import template_format from heat.engine import clients from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import scheduler from heat.engine.resources.neutron import network_gateway from heat.openstack.common.importutils import try_import from heat.tests import fakes from heat.tests import utils from heat.tests.common import HeatTestCase from mox import IgnoreArg neutronclient = try_import('neutronclient.v2_0.client') neutronV20 = try_import('neutronclient.neutron.v2_0') qe = try_import('neutronclient.common.exceptions') gw_template = ''' { 'AWSTemplateFormatVersion': '2010-09-09', 'Description': 'Template to test Network Gateway resource', 'Parameters': {}, 'Resources': { 'NetworkGateway': { 'Type': 'OS::Neutron::NetworkGateway', 'Properties': { 'name': 'NetworkGateway', 'tenant_id': '96ba52dc-c5c5-44c6-9a9d-d3ba1a03f77f', 'devices': [{'id': 'e52148ca-7db9-4ec3-abe6-2c7c0ff316eb', 'interface_name': 'breth1'}] } } } } ''' gwc_template = ''' { 'AWSTemplateFormatVersion': '2010-09-09', 'Description': 'Template to test Network Gateway Connection resource', 'Parameters': {}, 'Resources': { 'NetworkGatewayConnection': { 'Type': 'OS::Neutron::NetworkGatewayConnection', 'Properties': { 'network_id': '6af055d3-26f6-48dd-a597-7611d7e58d35', 'network_gateway_id': 'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', 'segmentation_type': 'vlan', 'segmentation_id': 10, } } } } ''' sng = { 'network_gateway': { 'name': 'NetworkGateway', 'default': False, 'tenant_id': '96ba52dc-c5c5-44c6-9a9d-d3ba1a03f77f', 'devices': [{ 'interface_name': 'breth1', 'id': 'e52148ca-7db9-4ec3-abe6-2c7c0ff316eb'}], 'id': 'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', 'ports': [{ 'segmentation_type': 'vlan', 'port_id': '32acc49c-899e-44ea-8177-6f4157e12eb4', 'segmentation_id': 10}] } } @skipIf(neutronclient is None, 'neutronclient unavailable') class NeutronNetworkGatewayTest(HeatTestCase): @skipIf(neutronV20 is None, 'Missing Neutron v2_0') def setUp(self): super(NeutronNetworkGatewayTest, self).setUp() self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'create_network_gateway') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'show_network_gateway') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'delete_network_gateway') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'connect_network_gateway') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'update_network_gateway') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'disconnect_network_gateway') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'list_networks') self.m.StubOutWithMock(clients.OpenStackClients, 'keystone') utils.setup_dummy_db() def prepare_create_network_gateway(self): clients.OpenStackClients.keystone().AndReturn( fakes.FakeKeystoneClient()) neutronclient.Client.create_network_gateway({ 'network_gateway': { 'name': u'NetworkGateway', 'tenant_id': u'96ba52dc-c5c5-44c6-9a9d-d3ba1a03f77f', 'devices': [{'id': u'e52148ca-7db9-4ec3-abe6-2c7c0ff316eb', 'interface_name': u'breth1'}] } } ).AndReturn({ 'network_gateway': { 'name': 'NetworkGateway', 'default': False, 'tenant_id': '96ba52dc-c5c5-44c6-9a9d-d3ba1a03f77f', 'devices': [{ 'interface_name': 'breth1', 'id': 'e52148ca-7db9-4ec3-abe6-2c7c0ff316eb'} ], 'id': 'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37' } } ) t = template_format.parse(gw_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(t) rsrc = network_gateway.NetworkGateway( 'test_network_gateway', t['Resources']['NetworkGateway'], stack) return rsrc def prepare_create_gateway_connection(self): clients.OpenStackClients.keystone().AndReturn( fakes.FakeKeystoneClient()) neutronclient.Client.connect_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', { 'network_id': u'6af055d3-26f6-48dd-a597-7611d7e58d35', 'segmentation_id': 10, 'segmentation_type': u'vlan' } ).AndReturn({ 'connection_info': { 'network_gateway_id': u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', 'network_id': u'6af055d3-26f6-48dd-a597-7611d7e58d35', 'port_id': u'32acc49c-899e-44ea-8177-6f4157e12eb4' } }) t = template_format.parse(gwc_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(t) rsrc = network_gateway.NetworkGatewayConnection( 'test_network_gateway_connection', t['Resources']['NetworkGatewayConnection'], stack) return rsrc def test_network_gateway(self): neutronclient.Client.show_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37' ).AndReturn(sng) neutronclient.Client.update_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', {'network_gateway': {'name': u'NetworkGateway2nd'}}).AndReturn(None) neutronclient.Client.disconnect_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', { 'network_id': u'6af055d3-26f6-48dd-a597-7611d7e58d35', 'segmentation_id': 10, 'segmentation_type': u'vlan' } ).AndReturn(None) neutronclient.Client.disconnect_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', { 'network_id': u'6af055d3-26f6-48dd-a597-7611d7e58d35', 'segmentation_id': 10, 'segmentation_type': u'vlan' } ).AndReturn(qe.NeutronClientException(status_code=404)) neutronclient.Client.delete_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37' ).AndReturn(None) neutronclient.Client.show_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37' ).AndReturn(sng) neutronclient.Client.show_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37' ).AndRaise(qe.NeutronClientException(status_code=404)) neutronclient.Client.delete_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37' ).AndRaise(qe.NeutronClientException(status_code=404)) rsrc = self.prepare_create_network_gateway() rsrc_con = self.prepare_create_gateway_connection() self.m.ReplayAll() rsrc.validate() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() rsrc_con.validate() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc_con.create)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.assertEqual((rsrc_con.CREATE, rsrc_con.COMPLETE), rsrc_con.state) ref_id = rsrc.FnGetRefId() self.assertEqual(u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', ref_id) self.assertEqual('NetworkGateway', rsrc.FnGetAtt('name')) self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute, rsrc.FnGetAtt, 'Foo') self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute, rsrc_con.FnGetAtt, 'Foo') snippet_for_update = { 'Type': u'OS::Neutron::NetworkGateway', 'Properties': { 'name': u'NetworkGateway2nd', 'tenant_id': u'96ba52dc-c5c5-44c6-9a9d-d3ba1a03f77f', 'devices': [{'id': u'e52148ca-7db9-4ec3-abe6-2c7c0ff316eb', 'interface_name': u'breth1'}] } } self.assertIsNone(rsrc.handle_update(snippet_for_update, IgnoreArg(), IgnoreArg())) self.assertRaises(resource.UpdateReplace, rsrc_con.handle_update, {}, {}, {}) self.assertIsNone(scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc_con.delete)()) self.assertEqual((rsrc_con.DELETE, rsrc_con.COMPLETE), rsrc_con.state) rsrc_con.state_set(rsrc_con.CREATE, rsrc_con.COMPLETE, 'to delete again') scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc_con.delete)() self.assertEqual((rsrc_con.DELETE, rsrc_con.COMPLETE), rsrc_con.state) self.assertIsNone(scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)()) self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) rsrc.state_set(rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.COMPLETE, 'to delete again') scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_network_gateway_with_flat(self): rsrc = self.prepare_create_network_gateway() clients.OpenStackClients.keystone().AndReturn( fakes.FakeKeystoneClient()) neutronclient.Client.connect_network_gateway( u'ed4c03b9-8251-4c09-acc4-e59ee9e6aa37', { 'network_id': u'6af055d3-26f6-48dd-a597-7611d7e58d35', 'segmentation_type': u'flat' Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests to have
more clear messages in case of failure.

commit_message:
add telemetry test cases - compute

verify instance's event type and status in meters when instance:
- suspend&resume
- stop&start
- pause&unpase

Partially implements blueprint add-basic-ceilometer-tests

Change-Id: Ia2004253043f430a52a905c5225215e70033bd77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/57/59957/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.server_id = cls.server['id'] resource_metadata["instance_flavor_id"]) @attr(type='gate') def test_meter_server_suspend_resume(self): # Verify suspend and resume event self.servers_client.suspend_server(self.server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, "SUSPENDED") _, resource = self.telemetry_client.get_resource_by_id(self.server_id) metadata = resource['metadata'] self.assertEquals(metadata['event_type'], "compute.instance.suspend") self.assertEquals(metadata['state'], "suspended") self.servers_client.resume_server(self.server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, "ACTIVE") _, resource =\ self.telemetry_client.get_resource_by_id(self.server_id) metadata = resource['metadata'] self.assertEquals(metadata['event_type'], "compute.instance.resume") self.assertEquals(metadata['state'], "active") @attr(type='gate') def test_meter_server_stop_start(self): # Verify stop and start event self.servers_client.stop(self.server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, "SHUTOFF") _, resource = self.telemetry_client.get_resource_by_id(self.server_id) metadata = resource['metadata'] self.assertEquals(metadata['event_type'], "compute.instance.power_off.end") self.assertEquals(metadata['state'], "stopped") self.servers_client.start(self.server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, "ACTIVE") _, resource = self.telemetry_client.get_resource_by_id(self.server_id) metadata = resource['metadata'] self.assertEquals(metadata['event_type'], "compute.instance.power_on.end") self.assertEquals(metadata['state'], "active") @attr(type='gate') def test_meter_server_pause_unpause(self): # Verify pause and unpause event self.servers_client.pause_server(self.server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, "PAUSED") _, resource = self.telemetry_client.get_resource_by_id(self.server_id) metadata = resource['metadata'] self.assertEquals(metadata['event_type'], "compute.instance.pause.end") self.assertEquals(metadata['state'], "paused") self.servers_client.unpause_server(self.server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, "ACTIVE") _, resource = self.telemetry_client.get_resource_by_id(self.server_id) metadata = resource['metadata'] self.assertEquals(metadata['event_type'], "compute.instance.unpause.end") self.assertEquals(metadata['state'], "active")

subject: Add ensure_export when volume is busy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-17 06:52:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/93df9d856d4a2a73ddff92b551a57dab70cd5828', 'message': "Revert to previous status if volume busy on delete

Currently when deleting a volume and it is busy, the manager will set
the status to 'available', even if the volume was in an error state.
The solution here is to save the previous state in the volume's
admin_metadata, and set to that.

Change-Id: Ieb840d8a2b83292e5ae74cb1fc5db5d895aafc73
Closes-Bug: #1236165
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-17 07:16:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5ef808377436a747d2cdf0a684135706f616aeb6', 'message': "Add ensure_export when volume is busy

Currently when deleting a volume and it is busy, cinder only
change the volume status.
If cinder fail to 'remove_export', cinder also need to do
'ensure_export'.

Change-Id: Ieb840d8a2b83292e5ae74cb1fc5db5d895aafc73
Closes-Bug: #1236165
"}]
commit_message:
Add ensure_export when volume is busy

Currently when deleting a volume and it is busy, cinder only
change the volume status.
If cinder fail to 'remove_export', cinder also need to do
'ensure_export'.

Change-Id: Ieb840d8a2b83292e5ae74cb1fc5db5d895aafc73
Closes-Bug: #1236165
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/41/73941/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not force and (volume['status'] != "available" or volume['status'].startswith("error")):
deleted_lines: if not force and volume['status'] not in ["available", "error", "error_restoring", "error_extending"]:

commit_message:
adding conversion from string to ISOTIME

In Glance API V2, currently, the value of "changes-since" isn't
converted from string to ISOTIME.

As a result, Attribute Error raises in "_make_conditions_from_filters"
 function of glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py.

In this patch, I added conversion from string to ISOTIME in reference
to "_get_filter" method of glance/registry/api/v1/images.py

Closes-bug: #1273975

Change-Id: I878cbd38766bda063cffc45c24b1986e9c747906
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/19/69819/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: changes_since = filters.get('changes-since', None) if changes_since: isotime = changes_since try: filters['changes-since'] = timeutils.parse_isotime(isotime) except ValueError: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(_("Unrecognized changes-since value"))

commit_message:
Replacement mox by mock

Replace mox testing library by mock one in the file
glance/tests/unit/common/test_client.py

Implements: blueprint replace-mox-with-mock

Change-Id: I620d9446c2ab14ae9aaa544de701281f739749cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/12/70712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mock import patch self.patcher = patch('httplib.HTTPConnection', request=None, getresponse=None) self.patcher.start() self.patcher.stop() with patch.object(auth, 'get_plugin_from_strategy') as mock_method: self.client.make_auth_plugin(creds, insecure) mock_method.assert_called_with('keystone', creds, insecure, configure_via_auth) with patch('httplib.HTTPConnection') as MockClass: instance = MockClass.return_value instance.getresponse.return_value = fake instance.getresponse.status_int = 200 headers = {"test": u'ni\xf1o'} resp = self.client.do_request('GET', '/v1/images/detail', headers=headers) self.assertEqual(resp, fake) with patch('httplib.HTTPConnection') as MockClass: instance = MockClass.return_value instance.getresponse.return_value = fake instance.getresponse.status_int = 200 params = {"test": u'ni\xf1o'} resp = self.client.do_request('GET', '/v1/images/detail', params=params) self.assertEqual(resp, fake)
deleted_lines: import httplib import mox self.mock = mox.Mox() self.mock.StubOutWithMock(httplib.HTTPConnection, 'request') self.mock.StubOutWithMock(httplib.HTTPConnection, 'getresponse') self.mock.UnsetStubs() self.mock.StubOutWithMock(auth, 'get_plugin_from_strategy') auth.get_plugin_from_strategy('keystone', creds, insecure, configure_via_auth) self.mock.ReplayAll() self.client.make_auth_plugin(creds, insecure) self.mock.VerifyAll() httplib.HTTPConnection.request( mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg()) # Lets fake the response # returned by httplib httplib.HTTPConnection.getresponse().AndReturn(fake) self.mock.ReplayAll() headers = {"test": u'ni\xf1o'} resp = self.client.do_request('GET', '/v1/images/detail', headers=headers) self.assertEqual(resp, fake) httplib.HTTPConnection.request( mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg()) # Lets fake the response # returned by httplib httplib.HTTPConnection.getresponse().AndReturn(fake) self.mock.ReplayAll() params = {"test": u'ni\xf1o'} resp = self.client.do_request('GET', '/v1/images/detail', params=params) self.assertEqual(resp, fake)

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-18 16:30:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/b12c4f89ab760b76ea576a7d45e5108fe6efd4db', 'message': 'Correct versions in the URLs

The Keystone Endpoints setup by Devstack and all of the other
installers have been appending the versions on to the URLs for
Keystone.  This binds an Open Stack deployment to a specific version of
the identity API, even if the Keystone server itself supports multiple
versions.

Merely removing the version string, however, does not fix the problem,
as the URL in the endpoint is not by itself usable.  If there is no
version appended, the client attempts to use the URL as is, and appends
on the suburl for the desired resource.  For example, if the endpoint
is https://hostname:35357  and the client is attempting to use the
v2 API to access users, it will generate the url
https://hostname:35357/user  which will fail.  It needs to generate
the URL:  https://hostname:35357/v3/user according to the identity
sepcification.

This change does two things.  At the base level, it removes any version
strings from the URLs.  Then at the API specific level, it appends
the appropriate version string onto the URL before attempting to
compose the suburls.

Discovery could potentially perform the second step.  Assuming that all
URLs were non-version specific, the client could make a call to the
endpoint to discover which version of the API is supported.  However, this does not make sense for three reasons:

1.  Discovery was performed already when the client was created.  The
client already knows which versions are supported.
2.  It is an additional roundtrip that would have to be made for every
call to the server.
3.  We already require a-priori knowledge to compose the URLs.  This
would perform a minimal additional server driven configuration, while
still failing to adequetly apply the principals of REST.

Regardless of the above, these changes are required in order to allow
access to the V3 API to deployemnt that currently have older clients
accessing the V2.0 APIs.

Blueprint: endpoint-versioning

Change-Id: I4ae0d9e250feb3f2974284645907ceaa50e9caf0

commit_message:
Correct versions in the URLs

The Keystone Endpoints setup by Devstack and all of the other
installers have been appending the versions on to the URLs for
Keystone.  This binds an Open Stack deployment to a specific version of
the identity API, even if the Keystone server itself supports multiple
versions.

Merely removing the version string, however, does not fix the problem,
as the URL in the endpoint is not by itself usable.  If there is no
version appended, the client attempts to use the URL as is, and appends
on the suburl for the desired resource.  For example, if the endpoint
is https://hostname:35357  and the client is attempting to use the
v2 API to access users, it will generate the url
https://hostname:35357/user  which will fail.  It needs to generate
the URL:  https://hostname:35357/v3/user according to the identity
specification.

This change does two things.
1) At the base level, it removes any version strings from the
Management URL.
2) At the API specific level, it appends the appropriate version string
onto the URL before attempting to compose the suburls.

Discovery could potentially perform the second step.  Assuming that all
URLs were non-version specific, the client could make a call to the
endpoint to discover which version of the API is supported.
However, this does not make sense for three reasons:

1.  Discovery was performed already when the client was created.  The
client already knows which versions are supported.
2.  It is an additional roundtrip that would have to be made for every
call to the server.
3.  We already require a-priori knowledge to compose the URLs.  This
would perform a minimal additional server driven configuration, while
still failing to adequetly apply the principals of REST.

Regardless of the above, these changes are required in order to allow
access to the V3 API to deployemnt that currently have older clients
accessing the V2.0 APIs.

Blueprint: endpoint-versioning

Change-Id: I4ae0d9e250feb3f2974284645907ceaa50e9caf0

commit_message:
Fix create grant when no group

When a grant is created using the v3 API (
PUT /v3/projects/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/roles/{role_id} or
/v3/domains/{domain_id}/...) and the group didn't exist, the server
would respond with a 404 Not Found for the group. While this makes
sense, the server should allow creating a grant for a group that
doesn't exist so that the group ID can be used with federation.

With this change, the server will return a 200 OK when a grant is
created using the v3 API even if the group isn't known to the
identity backend.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: I6a6c720321482584f9b60aca765289b50b0d58ee

commit_message:
Add Docker requirement

Use the docker-py module instead of custom REST code in Nova.

This reduces the amount of code we need to maintain and test
as part of OpenStack and separates the concern of maintaining
compatibility with upcoming API versions.

Change-Id: I7a47ec2aca9bcf1e54b68c6ba7270bed588fcb94

added_lines: class AffinityConstraint(BaseLinearConstraint): def __init__(self, variables, hosts, instance_uuids, request_spec, filter_properties): self.compute_api = compute.API() [self.num_hosts, self.num_instances] = self._get_host_instance_nums(hosts,instance_uuids,request_spec) def _get_host_instance_nums(self,hosts,instance_uuids,request_spec): """This method calculates number of hosts and instances""" num_hosts = len(hosts) if instance_uuids: num_instances = len(instance_uuids) else: num_instances = request_spec.get('num_instances', 1) return [num_hosts,num_instances]

commit_message:
Fix create grant when no user

When a grant is created using the v3 API (
PUT /v3/projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id} or
/v3/domains/{domain_id}/...) and the user didn't exist, the server
would respond with a 404 Not Found for the user. While this makes
sense, the server should allow creating a grant for a user that
doesn't exist so that the user ID can be used with federated users.

With this change, the server will return a 200 OK when a grant is
created using the v3 API even if the user isn't known to the
identity backend.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: If22227a7100200e8bf5c2420711b433b2ba49deb

commit_message:
Make engine configurable, make debugger show local variables

To make it easy to set Mistral for debugging.
1) Make engine configurable.
2) Enable debugger via command line. Passing --use-debugger will make PyDev or PyCharm show
 local variables in debugging session.

Change-Id: Id0874718571c28ace0ffa00da07c0706adf661ae

Draft Code for Vcenter neutron agent.

Load conf and loop report status as daemon.
Code from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72593/.
Implements: bp/vcenter-neutron-agent

Change-Id: Iacf43f397a4e99a5b1400f58df4622e5fc9d2045
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/73178/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import sys import threading import time import platform from oslo.config import cfg from neutron import context from neutron.common import constants as n_const from neutron.common import topics from neutron.agent import rpc as agent_rpc from neutron.openstack.common.rpc import dispatcher from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging from neutron.common import config as logging_config LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) ##TODO ## Add more configs. agent_opts = [ cfg.IntOpt( 'report_interval', default = 2, help ='Agent report status interval'), cfg.ListOpt( 'physical_network_vswitch_mappings', default=[], help=_('List of <physical_network>:<vswitch> ')) ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_cli_opts(agent_opts, 'AGENT') cfg.CONF(project='neutron') class VCenterNeutronAgent(object): """ Vmware VCenter neutron agent. A class for create vcenter Login/mangement session and loop report agent state . """ RPC_API_VERSION = '1.0' def __init__(self): self.loop_num = 0; ##TODO ##Replace with LOG module. self._polling_interval = CONF.AGENT.report_interval self._load_conf() def _load_conf(self): self.report_interval = CONF.AGENT.report_interval LOG.info("report_interval = %d" % self.report_interval) def _handle(self): while True: self._set_agent_state() self._setup_rpc() LOG.info("in loop %d" % self.loop_num) time.sleep(3) self.loop_num += 1 def daemon_loop(self): t = threading.Thread(target=self._handle) t.setDaemon(True) t.start() while t.isAlive(): try: time.sleep(3) except KeyboardInterrupt: os._exit(os.EX_OK) ##TODO ## Add more functiono prototype. def _report_state(self): pass def _create_rpc_dispatcher(self): return dispatcher.RpcDispatcher([self]) def _set_agent_state(self): self.agent_state = { 'binary': 'neutron-vcenter-agent', 'host': cfg.CONF.host , 'topic': n_const.L2_AGENT_TOPIC, 'configurations': {'vswitch_mappings': {'phy1':'vswitch1'}}, 'agent_type': 'Vcenter agent', 'start_flag': True} def _setup_rpc(self): self.agent_id = 'vcenter_%s' % platform.node() self.topic = topics.AGENT self.plugin_rpc = agent_rpc.PluginApi(topics.PLUGIN) self.state_rpc = agent_rpc.PluginReportStateAPI(topics.PLUGIN) # RPC network init self.context = context.get_admin_context_without_session() # Handle updates from service self.dispatcher = self._create_rpc_dispatcher() # Define the listening consumers for the agent consumers = [[topics.PORT, topics.UPDATE], [topics.NETWORK, topics.DELETE], [topics.PORT, topics.DELETE], ] # If u want to consume topic 'q-agent-notifier' message. self.connection = agent_rpc.create_consumers(self.dispatcher, self.topic, consumers) self.state_rpc.report_state(self.context,self.agent_state) def _load_whitelist(self): pass def _load_physical_network_mappings(self): pass def get_existing_portgroup(self): pass def _filter_portgroup(self): pass def main(): cfg.CONF(project='neutron') logging_config.setup_logging(cfg.CONF) agent = VCenterNeutronAgent() LOG.info("Agent ,running.....") agent.daemon_loop()

added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2014 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Author: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Unit tests for nova::compute::rbd class # require 'spec_helper' describe 'nova::compute::rbd' do let :params do { :rbd_user => 'nova', :rbd_secret_uuid => false, :images_rbd_pool => 'rbd', :images_rbd_ceph_conf => '/etc/ceph/ceph.conf' } end shared_examples_for 'nova compute rbd' do it { should contain_class('nova::params') } it 'configure nova.conf with default parameters' do should contain_nova_config('libvirt/images_type').with_value('rbd') should contain_nova_config('libvirt/images_rbd_pool').with_value('rbd') should contain_nova_config('libvirt/images_rbd_ceph_conf').with_value('/etc/ceph/ceph.conf') should contain_nova_config('libvirt/rbd_user').with_value('nova') end context 'when overriding default parameters' do before :each do params.merge!( :rbd_user => 'joe', :rbd_secret_uuid => false, :images_rbd_pool => 'AnotherPool', :images_rbd_ceph_conf => '/tmp/ceph.conf' ) end it 'configure nova.conf with overriden parameters' do should contain_nova_config('libvirt/images_type').with_value('rbd') should contain_nova_config('libvirt/images_rbd_pool').with_value('AnotherPool') should contain_nova_config('libvirt/images_rbd_ceph_conf').with_value('/tmp/ceph.conf') should contain_nova_config('libvirt/rbd_user').with_value('joe') end end context 'when using cephx' do before :each do params.merge!( :rbd_secret_uuid => 'UUID' ) end it 'configure nova.conf with RBD secret UUID' do should contain_nova_config('libvirt/rbd_secret_uuid').with_value('UUID') end end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end it_configures 'nova compute rbd' end context 'on RedHat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end it_configures 'nova compute rbd' end end

commit_message:
Sync latest config file generator from oslo-incubator

The fix to the config file generator to support lazy messages
is the main addition of interest because it is needed after
lazy messages were enabled.

Commits included:
  1a6dfb956 Sanitize FQDN in config generator
  e839886cc Config generator fails with lazy messages
  763eedff6 Fix DictOpt support in config sample generator

Partially implements blueprint i18n-messages
Closes-Bug: #1280826

Change-Id: I2174139ba3767d05924747cbefa377ba8780103d

commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy objects for the 'extension' resource

Added sqlalchemy objects for extension and migration script for alembic.
Added unit tests for CRUD db operations on extension objects

Change-Id: I52e9de6722da4ceaa1ec9957b1a767dc15d7bc2c

commit_message:
Blacklist pyghmi version 0.5.9.1

The 0.5.9.1 release of pyghmi appears to be broken
as it attempts to install a pre-compiled binary package
instead of correctly pointing to a source tarball.

Fixes bug 1281385

Change-Id: I7fa4e934a03562673485ed602d5e1fa805b4d46d

commit_message:
Blacklist pyghmi version 0.5.9.1

The 0.5.9.1 release of pyghmi appears to be broken
as it attempts to install a pre-compiled binary package
instead of correctly pointing to a source tarball.

Fixes bug 1281385

Change-Id: I8ac8c8429143b2a542a2fd8134acbb696c4e34e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/46/74246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move admin "delete a server" tests to test_servers

"delete a server" tests, which need the admin privilege, exist in
admin's test_servers. Now we have test_delete_server for testing
"delete a server", and it is better to move them into test_delete
_server for knowing the test coverage.

This patch moves admin "delete a server" tests to test_delete_server.

Change-Id: I079541df10ba7869eb5c6793e051cf93993f3972
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/58/75758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='gate') def test_delete_server_while_in_error_state(self): # Delete a server while it's VM state is Error resp, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') resp, body = self.servers_admin_client.reset_state(server['id'], state='error') self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) resp, _ = self.client.delete_server(server['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status'])

commit_message:
Clean network scenarios

Remove single-item collections (lists/dicts)
use filtered neutron queries and net_common objects (Deletable objects) in
loadbalancer_basic

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-advanced-scenarios

Change-Id: I265b7cd152f766a1f6dc63a84af8090f9ec3bc76

commit_message:
Add unit tests to tempest auth file

Some unit tests to tempest/auth.py which implements request authentication for
keystone v2 and v3 in tempest.

Still missing some tests to base_url methods that were failing, and need to be
reworked.

Partially implements bp unit-tests

Change-Id: I367caf4d83a33ad1675c2069e8ac0c442246f322

commit_message:
Catch NotImplementedError in get_spice_console in v2/v3 API

Currently get_spice_console doesn't catch NotImpelementedError
and it will lead to inaccurate information returned back
to API caller. This patch adds the catch exception routine and
returns a HTTPNotImplemented excpetion.

Closes-Bug: #1279195
Change-Id: I16cb0a83c0e1aa9a041dd21af324a39388ca3bb8

commit_message:
remove sysstat & pidstat

dstat is far cleaner for getting results out of the environment,
and covers the bulk of our use cases for sysstat and pidstat with
a much better ui.

devstack is allowed to be opinionated, so become opinionated here.

Change-Id: I21ec96339dcd704098512fdafd896738f352962d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/36/76236/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for DSTAT logging# Dstat
deleted_lines: # Enable sysstat logging SYSSTAT_FILE=${SYSSTAT_FILE:-"sysstat.dat"} SYSSTAT_INTERVAL=${SYSSTAT_INTERVAL:-"1"} PIDSTAT_FILE=${PIDSTAT_FILE:-"pidstat.txt"} PIDSTAT_INTERVAL=${PIDSTAT_INTERVAL:-"5"} # Sysstat and friends# If enabled, systat has to start early to track OpenStack service startup. # what we want to measure # -u : cpu statitics # -q : load # -b : io load rates # -w : process creation and context switch rates SYSSTAT_OPTS="-u -q -b -w" if [[ -n ${SCREEN_LOGDIR} ]]; then screen_it sysstat "cd $TOP_DIR; ./tools/sar_filter.py $SYSSTAT_OPTS -o $SCREEN_LOGDIR/$SYSSTAT_FILE $SYSSTAT_INTERVAL" else screen_it sysstat "./tools/sar_filter.py $SYSSTAT_OPTS $SYSSTAT_INTERVAL" fi # Per-process stats PIDSTAT_OPTS="-l -p ALL -T ALL" if [[ -n ${SCREEN_LOGDIR} ]]; then screen_it pidstat "cd $TOP_DIR; pidstat $PIDSTAT_OPTS $PIDSTAT_INTERVAL > $SCREEN_LOGDIR/$PIDSTAT_FILE" else screen_it pidstat "pidstat $PIDSTAT_OPTS $PIDSTAT_INTERVAL" fi

commit_message:
Bump python-savannaclient to 0.5.0

* it's first release with CLI covering mostly all features
* dev docs moved to client from the main repo
* support for all new Savanna features introduced in Icehouse release cycle
* single common entrypoint, actual - savannaclient.client.Client('1.1)
* 93 commits from the prev. release

Change-Id: Ib00dd24aacbdea146fcf33b1ec9f62b1b0533f38

commit_message:
Fixed itests to work with new savannaclient

* python-savannaclient 0.5 breaks compatibility with old its usage
  in integration tests
* added parameter Tenant ID for OpenStack to tests
* new initialisation method was added using single entrypoint
* removed savanna_url since it has wrong pattern and it's not needed
  anymore in this case
* other parameters cleanups are TBD, this fix is mostly to fix
  integration tests running
* savanna.job_executions.create call updated due to the removal of
  job_exec_data argument

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Lukjanov <slukjanov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I48e86cf486da354c1615602f084246d11b6a4670

commit_message:
Fix wrap target in iptables_manager

This patch fixes issues when using wrap target
for add_rule and remove_rule methods.

Change-Id: I01926719ef5ccf229748b9ceb1553e5314ab623e
Closes-bug: #1269189
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/56/67556/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rule = ' '.join(map(lambda els: self._wrap_target_chain(els, wrap), rule.split(' '))) def _wrap_target_chain(self, s, wrap): if s.startswith('$'): s = ('%s-%s' % (self.wrap_name, get_chain_name(s[1:], wrap))) if '$' in rule: rule = ' '.join(map(lambda els: self._wrap_target_chain(els, wrap), rule.split(' ')))
deleted_lines: rule = ' '.join(map(self._wrap_target_chain, rule.split(' '))) def _wrap_target_chain(self, s): if s.startswith('$'): return ('%s-%s' % (self.wrap_name, s[1:]))

commit_message:
Added libffi-dev to the needed packages

After pyOpenSSL 0.14 update, Grizzly devstack started failing:
 Downloading/unpacking cryptography>=0.2.1 (from pyOpenSSL->python-glanceclient==0.12.0.61.g8b76817)
   Running setup.py egg_info for package cryptography
     c/_cffi_backend.c:14:17: fatal error: ffi.h: No such file or directory

Change-Id: Ida7001886f17c9413b33312f12f2478a54bd6c90
(cherry picked from commit b6f7ea4fb0bfd4bcc1d1bb35f97d29eb70075b73)

subject: User a more accurate max_delay for reconnects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 10:13:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_qpid.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/dc1f984dacced6bbd56b4d97847be8a39b61036e', 'message': "User a more accurate max_delay for reconnects

In an HA deployment, a 60 seconds delay between reconnects can be quite
problematic. This patch changes the delay calculation by setting the max
delay to 5s and by changing the way it is increased.

Unfortunately, this is one of the places where both our main drivers are
not consistent. Rabbit's driver uses configuration parameters for this
whereas qpid's driver has never had one. However, I would prefer not
adding configuration paremeters to qpid's driver for the following
reasons:

    1. Most of OpenStack services depend on the messaging layer, hence
    they need it to be available. A 5s delay seems to be reasonable and
    I could argue the need of tune it further. Although so frequent
    reconnects can add load to the network, that wouldn't be the main
    issue if one of the brokers go down.
    2. We're trying to move away from configuration options towards using
    transport URL. This path is still not clear and I would
    prefer avoiding adding new options until we clear it out.

Change-Id: I537015f452eb770acba41fdedfe221628f52a920
Closes-bug: #1281148
"}]
commit_message:
User a more accurate max_delay for reconnects

In an HA deployment, a 60 seconds delay between reconnects can be quite
problematic. This patch changes the delay calculation by setting the max
delay to 5s and by changing the way it is increased.

Unfortunately, this is one of the places where both our main drivers are
not consistent. Rabbit's driver uses configuration parameters for this
whereas qpid's driver has never had one. However, I would prefer not
adding configuration paremeters to qpid's driver for the following
reasons:

    1. Most of OpenStack services depend on the messaging layer, hence
    they need it to be available. A 5s delay seems to be reasonable and
    I could argue the need of tune it further. Although so frequent
    reconnects can add load to the network, that wouldn't be the main
    issue if one of the brokers go down.
    2. We're trying to move away from configuration options towards using
    transport URL. This path is still not clear and I would
    prefer avoiding adding new options until we clear it out.

Change-Id: I537015f452eb770acba41fdedfe221628f52a920
Closes-bug: #1281148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/15/74315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: delay = min(delay + 1, 5)

commit_message:
Document virt driver methods that take Instance objects

This catches the virt driver base class' docstrings up with the
current state of support in manager for passing objects.

Related to blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: Ifc358b5e513a3194785fa83ffe7660b88de6e10a

commit_message:
Make interface attach and detach use objects

This makes the api pass instance objects to interface attach and
detach calls.

Related to blueprint virt-objects
Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: Iddb21fb5c733b06a7ceba67ae4e48a3bf6e157fb

commit_message:
Pass instance object to soft_delete() and get_info()

This makes compute manager pass an instance object to the
virt driver's soft_delete() and get_info method instead of a
dict primitive.

Related to blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: I52aae532c08596d7a78a3e75f8b0869951fc8991

commit_message:
libvirt: host specific virtio-rng backend

Users will be able to select an alternative source of entropy on the host,
by providing a path to the alternative device in nova.conf, instead of the
default /dev/random:

    rng_dev_path=/dev/hwrng

DocImpact
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-rng-device
Change-Id: Ibc2d1e9839ae2f5aeca14fbe966e8bc7c4427714

reset prereqs status on clean.sh

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-19 16:52:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/899138ec490f84bd9efabcbab08ed289b88a957c', 'message': 'Clean IMAGE_SNAPSHOT_PENDING state on compute manager start up

There is a slim possibility that an instance will make it into the
state IMAGE_SNAPSHOT_PENDING  and get to the compute host just prior
to the stopping/failure of the compute service, this will result
in the instance being stuck in this state after the service resumes
and will prevent further actions on the instace by the user.

This change clears this state on start-up. Worst case it may result
in the request to snapshot being lost which will require the user to
re-request but I think this is preferable to leaving the instance in
a transitional state that the user cannot clear.

commit_message:
Clean IMAGE_SNAPSHOT_PENDING state on compute manager start up

There is a slim possibility that an instance will make it into the
state IMAGE_SNAPSHOT_PENDING  and get to the compute host just prior
to the stopping/failure of the compute service, this will result
in the instance being stuck in this state after the service resumes
and will prevent further actions on the instace by the user.

This change clears this state on start-up. Worst case it may result
in the request to snapshot being lost which will require the user to
re-request but I think this is preferable to leaving the instance in
a transitional state that the user cannot clear.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: I8a4867f1f96d61e7d614d7d27c91f3d3e46f2400

commit_message:
3PAR: Fix extend volume GiB to MiB

Extend volume was sending GiB instead of MiB to the 3PAR
array. This patch is now sending the growth size in MiBs
instead of GiBs.

Change-Id: Ib4903315a32e090e760883cc80c50f3698fe015f
Closes-Bug: #1284368
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/76259/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.0.5 - Fix extend volume units bug #1284368 VERSION = "2.0.5" growth_size_mib = growth_size * units.KiB try: self.client.growVolume(volume_name, growth_size_mib)

commit_message:
3PAR: Create volume from snapshot with larger size

Refactored the migrate_volume code to be usable by both migrate volume
and create volume from snapshot with a larger size. The common functionality
is to clone a volume as a base volume. Migrate volume specifies a different
CPG, whereas create volume from snapshot uses the same CPG.

Change-Id: I4081807294d918fc0e9c2e17bae89b6df7ee1513
Closes-Bug: #1279478

added_lines: 2.0.4 - Allow volumes created from snapshots to be larger bug #1279478 VERSION = "2.0.4" def _copy_volume(self, src_name, dest_name, cpg, snap_cpg=None, if volume['size'] < snapshot['volume_size']: err = ("You cannot reduce size of the volume. It must " "be greater than or equal to the snapshot.") # Grow the snapshot if needed growth_size = volume['size'] - snapshot['volume_size'] if growth_size > 0: try: LOG.debug(_('Converting to base volume type: %s.') % volume['id']) self._convert_to_base_volume(volume) growth_size_mib = growth_size * units.GiB / units.MiB LOG.debug(_('Growing volume: %(id)s by %(size)s Mib.') % {'id': volume['id'], 'size': growth_size_mib}) self.client.growVolume(volume_name, growth_size_mib) except Exception as ex: LOG.error(_("Error extending volume %(id)s. Ex: %(ex)s") % {'id': volume['id'], 'ex': str(ex)}) #Delete the volume if unable to grow it self.client.deleteVolume(volume_name) raise exception.CinderException(ex) false_ret = (False, None) # Make sure volume is not attached if volume['status'] != 'available': LOG.debug(_('Volume is attached: migrate_volume: ' 'id=%(id)s, host=%(host)s.') % dbg) return false_ret if 'location_info' not in host['capabilities']: return false_ret info = host['capabilities']['location_info'] try: (dest_type, dest_id, dest_cpg) = info.split(':') except ValueError: return false_ret sys_info = self.client.getStorageSystemInfo() if not (dest_type == 'HP3PARDriver' and dest_id == sys_info['serialNumber']): LOG.debug(_('Dest does not match: migrate_volume: ' 'id=%(id)s, host=%(host)s.') % dbg) return false_ret type_info = self.get_volume_settings_from_type(volume) if dest_cpg == type_info['cpg']: LOG.debug(_('CPGs are the same: migrate_volume: ' 'id=%(id)s, host=%(host)s.') % dbg) return false_ret # Check to make sure CPGs are in the same domain src_domain = self.get_domain(type_info['cpg']) dst_domain = self.get_domain(dest_cpg) if src_domain != dst_domain: LOG.debug(_('CPGs in different domains: migrate_volume: ' 'id=%(id)s, host=%(host)s.') % dbg) return false_ret self._convert_to_base_volume(volume, new_cpg=dest_cpg) # TODO(Ramy) When volume retype is available, # use that to change the type LOG.debug(_('leave: migrate_volume: id=%(id)s, host=%(host)s.') % dbg) return (True, None) def _convert_to_base_volume(self, volume, new_cpg=None): try: if new_cpg: cpg = new_cpg else: cpg = type_info['cpg'] cpg, cpg, type_info['tpvv']) LOG.debug(_('Copy volume scheduled: convert_to_base_volume: ' 'id=%s.') % volume['id']) dbg = {'status': status, 'id': volume['id']} msg = _('Copy volume task failed: convert_to_base_volume: ' 'id=%(id)s, status=%(status)s.') % dbg LOG.debug(_('Copy volume completed: convert_to_base_volume: ' 'id=%s.') % volume['id']) LOG.debug(_('Volume rename completed: convert_to_base_volume: ' 'id=%s.') % volume['id']) LOG.debug(_('Delete src volume completed: convert_to_base_volume: ' 'id=%s.') % volume['id']) LOG.info(_('Completed: convert_to_base_volume: ' 'id=%s.') % volume['id'])

commit_message:
Add rolling upgrade test for nova-compute

Add rolling upgrade test for nova-compute. Nova wants to support the ability
to run stable/havana nova-compute with icehouse everything else. This sets
up a test for that.

When $DO_NOT_UPGRADE_SERVICES contains "n-cpu", the final environment
will be trunk everything except havana nova-compute.  Although
$DO_NOT_UPGRADE_SERVICES takes a list of services other parts of grenade
have to be fixed to support values besides "n-cpu", but a list is used
because in the future we want to support adding other values to this
list.

Change-Id: Ifb733ee2fe0c5bba61b43ae19dca7040c12f7893
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/74/64074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # rolling nova-compute support if [[ "$NOVA_COMPUTE_ROLLING_UPGRADE" == "True" ]]; then iniset $NOVA_CONF upgrade_levels compute havana fi

so we can keep the old nova-compute up for rolling upgrade testing. No

Instead of testing the upgrade path by stopping everything, this allows

stop-base already stop services, so don't need to do it again in
upgrade-nova. This is needed So we can keep the old nova-compute up for
rolling upgrade testing. Instead of killing the entire screen process
kill all the services inside of it. Note: if one of those services isn't
running to begin with screen will just return 0.

stop-base is the preferred place to manage the stop logic, because it
has access to the base devstack's stop-* commands.

Change-Id: Ifa2b6305f1f6bbe41407ca12a0f3cbc99b09f301

commit_message:
Remove stop nova processes from upgrade-nova

stop-base already stop services, so don't need to do it again in
upgrade-nova. This is needed So we can keep the old nova-compute up for
rolling upgrade testing. Instead of killing the entire screen process
kill all the services inside of it.

stop-base is the preferred place to manage the stop logic, because it
has access to the base devstack's stop-* commands.

Change-Id: Ifa2b6305f1f6bbe41407ca12a0f3cbc99b09f301
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/65/63965/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: echo "Shutting down devstack in screen" # Shut down running processes in screen - most of them SCREEN=$(which screen) if [[ -n "$SCREEN" ]]; then SESSION=$(screen -ls | awk "/[0-9].${SCREEN_NAME}/ { print \$1 }") if [[ -n "$SESSION" ]]; then screen -X -S $SESSION quit sleep 2 fi fi

commit_message:
Add template for single node instance of OpenShift

This has been tested on CentOS 6.5 as far as the deployment guide
indicates in section 11:
http://openshift.github.io/documentation/
oo_deployment_guide_comprehensive.html#testing-the-configuration

Change-Id: I40766a46fb45e618e35a4f7a3662bd693ac8613c

LinuxDistribution: Default: F17 Description: Distribution of choice Type: String AllowedValues: [F18, F17, U10, RHEL-6.1, RHEL-6.2, RHEL-6.3, CentOS-6.5] Mappings: AWSInstanceType2Arch: m1.tiny: {Arch: '32'} m1.small: {Arch: '64'} m1.medium: {Arch: '64'} m1.large: {Arch: '64'} m1.xlarge: {Arch: '64'} DistroArch2AMI: F18: {'32': F18-i386-cfntools, '64': F18-x86_64-cfntools} F17: {'32': F17-i386-cfntools, '64': F17-x86_64-cfntools} U10: {'32': U10-i386-cfntools, '64': U10-x86_64-cfntools} RHEL-6.1: {'32': rhel61-i386-cfntools, '64': rhel61-x86_64-cfntools} RHEL-6.2: {'32': rhel62-i386-cfntools, '64': rhel62-x86_64-cfntools} RHEL-6.3: {'32': rhel63-i386-cfntools, '64': rhel63-x86_64-cfntools} CentOS-6.5: {'32': centos-6.5-i386-cfntools, '64': centos-6.5-x86_64-cfntools} Resources: WikiDatabase: Type: AWS::EC2::Instance Metadata: AWS::CloudFormation::Init: config: packages: yum: augeas: [] tar: [] yum-utils: [] bind: [] Properties: ImageId: Fn::FindInMap: - DistroArch2AMI - {Ref: LinuxDistribution} - Fn::FindInMap: - AWSInstanceType2Arch - {Ref: InstanceType} - Arch InstanceType: {Ref: InstanceType} KeyName: {Ref: KeyName} UserData: Fn::Base64: Fn::Join: - '' - - '#!/bin/bash -v ' - export PREFIX= - {Ref: Prefix} - ' ' - export UPSTREAM_DNS= - {Ref: UpstreamDNS} - ' ' - '/opt/aws/bin/cfn-init ' - 'yum -y install http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/6/x86_64/epel-release-6-8.noarch.rpm ' - 'yum -y install http://yum.puppetlabs.com/el/6/products/x86_64/puppetlabs-release-6-10.noarch.rpm ' - 'yum -y install nodejs-nan ' - 'mkdir -p /etc/puppet/modules && cd /etc/puppet/modules ' - 'yumdownloader nodejs-bson ' - 'yum install -y puppet facter ' - 'puppet module install openshift/openshift_origin --version 3.0.1 ' - '/usr/sbin/dnssec-keygen -a HMAC-MD5 -b 512 -n USER -r /dev/urandom -K /var/named ${PREFIX} ' - 'openshift_password1 => ''password'', ' - 'install_method => ''yum'', ' - 'jenkins_repo_base => ''http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat'', ' - 'development_mode => true, ' - '} ' - 'EOF ' - puppet apply --verbose configure_origin.pp | tee /var/log/configure_origin.log; - commit_message:
Reduce number of novaclient calls

Currently, each client creates a new session for
each call. This fix makes novaclient re-use
sessions in the most obvoius cases.

Partial-Bug: #1247056

Change-Id: Ie99ecb66304cf40e4f5fdd31fab5162ed11b863e

commit_message:
Serialize the notification payload in json

When a notification payload is passed to the oslo.messaging the
payload must be correctly serialized.

This change encode the payload into json as the old rpc did.

Closes bug: #1279881

Change-Id: I99fc2a4b0e0146c9faa6abeddbd15cb24169e024
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/74977/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix missing libffi-devel for python-glanceclient

python-glanceclient is failing to install on rhel6 with a dependency
chain from pip as

  cryptography>=0.2.1 (from pyOpenSSL>=0.11->python-glanceclient==0.12.0.56.gb8a850c)

cryptography requires libffi-devel to build.  I'm not sure what
changed, but remove it from "testonly" so it is always installed.

However, RHEL6 includes this in the optional repo, so we enable this
repo in the fixup script.

Change-Id: I9da0e91b75f41578861ee9685b8c7e91dd12dae7
